intro: Pleurocoronis pluriseta, commonly known as the hairy false lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with six petals and prominent stamens. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
